intro: Alibertia duckeana, commonly known as the Amazonian quinine or red sandalwood, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments within the rainforest understory. Due to its unique chemical composition, it has been studied for potential medicinal properties.
